valuation_data_1A.text: Ather Energy has raised $502M over 19 rounds: 2 Seed, 4 Early-Stage, 8 Late-Stage, and 5 Debt. The largest round was a $128M Series E in Jan 2022 led by Hero MotoCorp. Key funding rounds include a $71.5M Series E on Aug 13, 2024, a $109M Series E on Sep 05, 2023, and a $35.1M Series D on Nov 07, 2020. NIIF led the latest round on Aug 13, 2024. Ather Energy has 36 investors, including 15 institutional investors like Hero MotoCorp, NIIF, Innoven Capital, Stride Ventures, GIC, Caladium Investment, Herald Investment Management, Scale Venture Partners, Navam Capital and Volpi Cupal Trust. The post money valuation was $980M (Aug 13, 2024) and $447M (May 28, 2019).

Ather Energy, founded in 2013 in Bengaluru, India by Arun Vinayak, Tarun Mehta, and Swapnil Jain, is a public Electric vehicle manufacturer specializing in scooters and associated charging infrastructure. They operate in the B2C and B2B space within the Energy Tech and Auto Tech market segments. Ather Energy has raised $502M in funding from investors like Hero MotoCorp, NIIF, and Tiger Global Management, most recently a Series E round on Aug 13, 2024 for $71.5M led by NIIF. It has 383 active competitors, including Ola Electric, BGauss and Gogoro. Ather Energy's annual revenue was 1,810Cr as on Mar 31, 2023, and it had 1,630 employees as of Mar 31, 2025. The legal entity's revenue was $216M as on Mar 31, 2024.

Ather Energy raised Rs 286 crore ($34.5 million) via debt and equity in its first investment round this year, with Stride Ventures investing Rs 200 crore via debentures, and co-founders Tarun Sanjay Mehta and Swapnil Babanlal Jain contributing Rs 43.28 crore each. Last year, Ather raised Rs 900 crore ($108 million) from Hero MotoCorp and GIC, with Hero MotoCorp also acquiring an additional 3% stake for Rs 140 crore ($16.8 million). Ather, valued at $750 million in May 2022, is reportedly in talks to raise $95 million pre-IPO. Sachin Bansal reportedly sold a significant portion of his stake to Nikhil Kamath. Ather has raised around $450 million to date, with Hero MotoCorp being the largest external stakeholder. Revenue in FY23 surged to Rs 1,784 crore, while losses spiked to Rs 864.5 crore. Electric two-wheeler sales dropped 50% in April, with Ather selling 4,000 units compared to 17,000 in March. Ola Electric sold over 33,000 units in April.

Ather Energy became a unicorn, valued at $1.3 billion (Rs 10,900 crore), after a Rs 600 crore ($71 million) funding round led by existing investor NIIF. It's India's fourth unicorn this year, following Rapido. NIIF first invested in Ather in May 2022. Hero MotoCorp, Ather's largest backer with 40% shareholding, previously invested at a $671 million valuation. Sachin Bansal exited Ather, selling his stake to Nikhil Kamath. Ola Electric, Athers bigger rival, has a market cap of $5.7 billion. In May, Ather raised Rs 286 crore ($34 million) from founders Tarun Mehta and Swapnil Jain, and Stride Ventures. Mehta and Jain each own about 7% of Ather.
